body:
Comment 1: 
This rule allows to write, for example

        func square(n int) int { return n*n }

even though the formal grammar requires the return statement to be terminated by a
(explicit or injected) semicolon. Without this rule one would have to write

        func square(n int) int { return n*n; }

instead, because the semicolon is never injected elsewhere than as the last token of a
line.

#WAI
